name: Leptandra
Relationship: Compare: PODO.; IRIS; BRY.; MERC.; PTEL.; MYRICA.

Head: Dull frontal pain; vertigo, drowsiness, and depression
Smarting and aching in eyes
Stomach: Great distress in stomach and intestines, with desire for stool
Aching in region of liver extending to spine, which feels chilly
Stool: Profuse, BLACK, FETID STOOLS, with pain at umbilicus
Typhoid stools turn black and look like tar

details: A liver remedy, with jaundice and BLACK, TARRY STOOLS. Bilious states. Enfeebled portal circulation. Malarial conditions.
